title: Bank of Uganda
text:
The Bank of Uganda () is the <a href="central%20bank">central bank</a> of <a href="Uganda">Uganda</a>. Established in 1966, by Act of Parliament, the bank is wholly owned by the government but is not a government department.
History.
In <a href="History%20of%20Uganda%20%281979%E2%80%93present%29">1979</a> and again in <a href="Ugandan%20shilling">1987</a>, the Bank of Uganda managed to keep a currency rate of 7 shillings for 1 US$. Starting in 1987, the IMF backed the development of the Bank of Uganda, and completed its first stage of recapitalizing the central bank in 1997.
At the <a href="AFI%20Global%20Policy%20Forum">AFI Global Policy Forum</a> held in <a href="Riviera%20Maya">Riviera Maya</a> in Mexico in 2011, the Bank of Uganda was one of the original 17 regulatory institutions to make specific national commitments to financial inclusion under <a href="The%20Maya%20Declaration">The Maya Declaration</a>.
In June 2019, 7 directors of the bank were fired after accusations of printing their own money bills.
Organization.
The <a href="board%20of%20directors">board of directors</a> of the Bank of Uganda is the bank's supreme policy making body. It is chaired by the governor or, in his or her absence, by the deputy governor.
The duties and powers of the board are specified by the Bank of Uganda Act. This Act makes the board responsible for the general management of the affairs of the bank. The board formulates policy and ensures that anything required to be done by the bank under the statute as well as anything else that is within or incidental to the functioning of the bank is carried out.
The <a href="president%20of%20Uganda">president of Uganda</a> appoints both the governor and the deputy governor, on the advice of the <a href="Cabinet%20of%20Uganda">cabinet</a>, for five-year renewable terms. Other members of the board (not fewer than four and not more than six) are appointed by the minister of finance for three-year renewable terms. The secretary to the treasury is an ex-officio member of the board.
As of June 2019, the bank employed 1,066 people. The bank of Uganda is a member of the Alliance for Financial Inclusion.
The <a href="Governor%20of%20the%20Bank%20of%20Uganda">Governor of the Bank of Uganda</a> since 2001 was <a href="Emmanuel%20Tumusiime-Mutebile">Emmanuel Tumusiime-Mutebile</a> (1949-2022).
Currency centers.
The central bank maintains branches and currency centers in various locations around the country, whose purpose is to store, process and monitor the supply of currency to the government and private financial institutions in the surrounding cities, towns, and villages.
